title: Judah (son of Jacob)
summary: Judah (Hebrew: יְהוּדָה‎, Modern: Yəhūda, Tiberian: Yehūḏā) was, according to the Book of Genesis, the fourth son of Jacob and Leah, the  founder of the Israelite Tribe of Judah. By extension, he is indirectly eponymous of the Kingdom of Judah, the land of Judea and the word Jew.
